text:
I've only been here once, but it's very unlikely that I'll return.  Why?  Because there is a freakin' McDonald's right next door!  If you follow my reviews, you will know that *unfortunately, for my body* I love Mickey D's!  So the first time I saw the McDonald's and this Burger King side by side, I was shocked because I had never seen the two fast food giants in such close proximity to each other!

Anyway, my friend and I had enjoyed a DELICIOUS early dinner at Antico Pizza one Saturday afternoon and were in need of some coffee before our drive back home up north.  So we walked across the street to the Burger King.  I usually get my iced coffee from McDonald's, but for whatever reason, we decided to go to BK this time.

When I walked in, I was impressed with the interior design of this BK!  It looks like it must have been renovated fairly recently.  There were comfy-looking, cushiony seats at some of the tables, which actually turned out to be pretty comfy!  And the best thing I noticed about this particular BK is that they have not one but TWO Coke Freestyle machines!  I thought that was pretty awesome.

However, there were only two other customers in this BK while there were way more right next door.  Hmmm...  Not good...

My friend ordered a regular coffee and I decided to try their Iced Seattle's Best Vanilla Coffee.  At only $1.49 for a small iced coffee, it was reasonably priced.  However, it was probably the worst vanilla iced coffee I had ever had in my life.  I told my friend that it was way too sweet (too much syrup!) and literally tasted like melted coffee ice cream.  Gross...  =P  But I needed the caffeine and had already walked out before I had really had a chance to taste it, so I sucked it up (literally!) and just drank it.  Never again...

Overall, based on my one visit (since I probably won't return), this Burger King gets 2.5 stars rounded up to 3 stars.  It's "OK" because I like the layout and design as well as the Coke Freestyle machines, but I must repeat that the iced coffee was terrible.  The employees seemed friendly enough, and we got our coffees quickly since we were the only other customers besides the two who were already there.  Check out this BK if you happen to be craving Whoppers while passing through the area, but I would go to the McDonald's next door if you can't decided between the two.

text:
I've never been to such a huge dumpster fire of a fast food restaurant before in my life.

I sometimes go to fast food places because my dogs love nuggets. Yes I know I'm both a pushover and a bad dog father, but goddamnit they love their nuggies. So I indulge them once a week. I figured why not get a couple of my favorite childhood sandwiches as well?

I had actually been thinking about original chicken sandwiches lately. It's been a while, and I used to love them. Crispy, zesty, elongated, chicken sandwiches. Simple. Delicious.

When I got to the drive through, it took a bit for someone to speak. I don't know if you are supposed to speak first these days, so maybe that's my fault.

I stated that I wanted two original chicken sandwiches and the attendant said "ok so 2 spicy crispy chicken sandwiches" and I replied that what she responded was mistaken and that I wanted two plain regular ORIGINAL chicken sandwiches, to which she replied "ok so two crispy chicken sandwiches" to which I, a third time, said original chicken sandwich. I said we might be getting it mixed up and asked if there was a difference between crispy chicken, and original chicken, because they appear to be different items on the menu. They were. She then responded "oh ok so you want three original chicken sandwiches."

...just the two will be fine...

So after that she asks if I want anything else. More like she says "...anythingelseforyou?" So I ordered a side of fries and some mozzarella sticks. 

"2 chicken sandwiches and a fries. Anything else?"

"Yes the mozzarella sticks as well please, and two orders of chicken nuggets"

"...thatallforyou?"

I pull up, pay, make sure the items are correct on my receipt, good to go. I get the bag and drive off. I'm snacking on my fries on the way home, and realize the load is a bit small, so I pull over and inspect my bag, and notice no nuggets. UGH! So I head back.

I retrieve my nuggets, which came with a bonus taco, and finally make it home. 

I soothe my beasts with their nuggies, put away more for tomorrow, and sit down to eat my chicken sandwiches. I have been waiting for this moment. 

I open the wrapper, and...mold. There's mold on this bread. I'm in the restaurant industry, shit happens, so I go to tear off the bit with the mold, and upon touching it I realize it's all stale. My fingers graze the sides of the chicken patty, and it's soggy. I open the bun...and the lettuce is rotten.

Like...at this point...I have thoroughly died inside. How....like why the fuck....

Ok so if I were working there, and had fucked up interpreting this guys order three goddamn times, I'd want to make DAMN sure the rest of his order was right or at LEAST in the damn bags. You better BELIEVE I'm getting back into that line making sure those sandwiches are goddamn flawless, and you better fucking believe I'm in front of that monitor making sure EVERY GODDAMN ITEM makes it into the bag. Even if it was just to save my own integrity. 

I get it kids. It's not considered "cool" to work at a fast food place, of all times during the summer, of al times during the weekend. I get it, but while you are there, you need to be one hundred percent there. And this was not that.

For real this experience was more than enough for me to feel good that I don't eat fast food all that often, but I really feel bad for people that are eating that shit on a regular basis.

There are plenty of free parking spaces in the mall parking lot.

text:
It such a shame this business is in a prime location but is by far the best example in Columbus of "Service without a smile".  Noting other the reviews here it is true that the McDonalds across the street is always lined out in the double lane drive thru but there is never a queue for Burger King's drive thru.  Which mind you they usually take 15 minutes per car to actually distribute a customer's order anyways.

The main issue with this location is the absolute lack of respect for other people and lack of professionalism.  I caught on to their little game where if they don't want to make something they just say "we don't have X".  To test my theory I went and ordered a "Brownie Sunday" was told "we don't have milkshake mix to make it".  I come back 1 hour later and behold they have the milkshake mix.  This was at 9:00PM.  This location also has a tendency to backtalk their patrons, probably a first and the only location I ever experienced this.  They also yell at each other (using unprofessional language including racial terms that were audible to the dining room) behind the counter while there were customers in the dining room and that alone should have been not to visit the location again.

Finally the employees here are poorly trained.  Over a 3 month period I order  the same meal with a coupon 3 times.  In the 3 times I order the exact same meal I was charged 3 different ways and received the order 3 different ways, basically they never got the order right.  The meal in question was Whopper Value meal only Mustard, Ketchup and Cheese with a Coke.  I would say that shouldn't be hard to mess up but they were 0-3 in getting the order correct.  The times were weekday dining, weekend late night (about 10) and weekend lunch (about noon) so you can't blame the night shift on this.

I wish I can express these concerns to Burger King directly but the only thing I can see is some automated system so knowing how corporate america goes it probably will be shifted somewhere and never read.  Shame too because I enjoy Burger King but like everyone else at Easton its just easier to cross the street and go to McDonalds.

text:
The reviews made me leery, and pulling up to an empty building on a Saturday night at Easton made me wonder again.  No inside dining, of course, but not even anyone in the drive-through?  Hm.  But, I didn't want McDonald's or Steak and Shake, and did want a burger, and Baby K was asleep in the back so it had to be drive-through.  

I got K a kid's meal- burger and fries.  They were out of apple slices and apple juice, so, "chockit juice" for her drink.  She hasn't tried any of it yet.

I got the Steakhouse burger (I think it's called.)  Big, meaty, kinda expensive.  The picture was enticing.  The burger itself didn't quite live up to that, of course.  Held together well, surprisingly.  Looked decent.  And tasted: good enough.  The bun was dry, almost stale.  The burger was overcooked and dry.
